Description

Play, or Die Trying is a game about playful interaction with dangerous objects.

  • Jam things into a plug socket!
  • Fish around inside a toaster!
  • Submerge a hairdryer!

This game is currently under development.

History

Play, or Die Trying promotes playful interaction with objects that we usually understand as dangerous and that should be handled with care. Objects such as plug sockets, toasters, hair dryers and other common household devices all possess the ability to injure or kill their users if handled improperly. Play, or Die Trying takes these real physical objects, makes them safe, and asks users to play with them in order to complete tasks within a game. Specifically, play with them in a way that would present a clear danger to life if performed on unaltered electronics. The devices have all been modified in a way to remove their high voltage/current components and have had components added that allow communication with a computer. Players playing the game are under interesting tension, as they seek to play in a way as allowed by the game, but, unable to completely drop the idea that these objects may be dangerous, they conflict with their own tendency towards self-preservation. With all this, the game seeks to ask its users to consider how anything may be an opportunity for play, how play only requires a playful attitude, and is a powerful democratic force.
